title: How to Open the Windows 10 Settings App

steps.title: Click the Start menu and select Settings .
steps.content: Click the Start menu and select Settings . The gear icon near the lower left corner of the Start menu is a quick and easy way to open your Windows 10 settings.

steps.title: Press the Windows key + I keyboard keys at the same time.
steps.content: Press the Windows key + I keyboard keys at the same time. This is a very quick and convenient way to open Settings.

steps.title: Type settings into the Windows Search bar and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type settings into the Windows Search bar and press ↵ Enter . If you don't see the Search bar in the taskbar at the bottom of the screen, click the circle or magnifying glass icon to open it first. You can also press the Windows key on your keyboard to activate search.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+X and click Settings.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + X and click Settings . The Ctrl + X shortcut opens a secret Windows menu that gives you quick access to Settings, task manager, device manager, and more. You can also access the Power User menu by right-clicking the Start menu.

steps.title: Click the speech bubble icon and select All settings.
steps.content: Click the speech bubble icon and select All settings . The Action Center (near the clock) is where you can view any notifications on your device. You can perform actions using the tiles at the bottom (called quick actions), including this tile that opens the Settings app. If you only see four tiles, click the "Expand" link to show the rest of them.

steps.title: Click the Microsoft Copilot button.
steps.content: Click the Microsoft Copilot button. If you have Microsoft Copilot, the latest AI feature from Microsoft, for Windows 10, you can use it to open the Settings app. Look for a blue and pink icon to the right of the clock. If you don't see this icon, Copilot may not be available for your device. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Type open windows settings and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type open windows settings and press ↵ Enter . Copilot will reply, asking if you want to open Settings.

steps.title: Click Yes.
steps.content: Click Yes . The Settings app will launch.

steps.title: Open File Explorer.
steps.content: Open File Explorer. A fast way to do this is to right-click the Start menu and select File Explorer .

steps.title: Select This PC in the left pane.
steps.content: Select This PC in the left pane.

steps.title: Click the Computer tab at the top and select Open Settings.
steps.content: Click the Computer tab at the top and select Open Settings . It's the blue and white gear icon in the toolbar at the top of File Explorer. Alternatively, select the local drive Windows is installed on, navigate to "Windows\ImmersiveControlPanel", and then open "SystemSettings" or "SystemSettings.exe".

steps.title: Open Command Prompt.
steps.content: Open Command Prompt. To do this, type cmd into the Windows Search bar, then click Command Prompt . If you don't see the search bar in the taskbar at the bottom of the screen, click the circle or magnifying glass icon first.

steps.title: Type start ms-settings:
steps.content: Type start ms-settings: . Type it exactly as written at the prompt.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . This opens the Settings app.

steps.title: Open PowerShell.
steps.content: Open PowerShell. Type powershell into the Windows search bar and press ↵ Enter to run PowerShell . If you don't see the search bar in the taskbar at the bottom of the screen, click the circle or magnifying glass icon first.

steps.title: Type start ms-settings:
steps.content: Type start ms-settings: .

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . You will now see the Windows Settings app.

steps.title: Press Windows Key + R on the keyboard.
steps.content: Press Windows Key + R on the keyboard. This opens the Run dialog window.

steps.title: Type start ms-settings:
steps.content: Type start ms-settings: .

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . The Settings window will now open.

steps.title: Use Control Panel to open specific pages in the Settings app.
steps.content: Use Control Panel to open specific pages in the Settings app. You can launch Control Panel by clicking or tapping the search bar (or magnifying glass icon), typing control panel , and then pressing ↵ Enter or selecting the matching result. You can use the Control Panel to jump to different areas of the Settings app: System and Security > Security and Maintenance > Recovery . If you're having problems with your PC, this will help you reset it. User Accounts > User Accounts . Make changes to my account in PC settings. Appearance and Personalization > Taskbar and Navigation (or Navigation properties). This takes you to your Taskbar settings. Appearance and Personalization > Turn High contrast on or off . Quick access to high-contrast theme settings. Time and Language . Make changes regarding the display language of the system or the timezone.

steps.title: Right-click the desktop and select Personalize.
steps.content: Right-click the desktop and select Personalize . This takes you to the Personalization area of the Settings app. You can also navigate the rest of the Settings app by clicking Home at the upper-left corner.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+Esc.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + Esc . This quick keyboard shortcut launches Task Manager, another place from which you can launch the Settings app in Windows 10.

steps.title: Click the File menu and select Run new task.
steps.content: Click the File menu and select Run new task . The "Create new task" window will appear.

steps.title: Type start ms-settings:
steps.content: Type start ms-settings: and click OK . The Windows Settings app will now open.

steps.title: Type the setting you're looking for into the search bar.
steps.content: Type the setting you're looking for into the search bar. If you want to bypass the Settings app and head right to the setting you want to view or modify, just type the name of the setting into the search bar on the taskbar. For example, type color , and then select Color settings to open the Colors area of your Personalization settings.

steps.title: Click the Start menu and hover your cursor over the Settings app.
steps.content: Click the Start menu and hover your cursor over the Settings app. If you want to make the Settings app super easy to find in the future, you can pin it to your taskbar.

steps.title: Right-click the Settings app.
steps.content: Right-click the Settings app. A list of options will appear.

steps.title: Click Pin to taskbar.
steps.content: Click Pin to taskbar . You can now click the Settings icon in the taskbar to open Windows Settings.
